section.p: The following actions are required to ensure that the risks and hazards associated with Hot End operations are appropriately controlled:

ol.li: Adherence to the required Personal Protective Equipment (PPE).
Regular housekeeping inspection and monitoring programs are in place.
Risk assessments and job safety analysis have been completed.
Ensure that procedures are in place to control the risk of accessing the regenerator and melter crowns.
Ensure that procedures are in place to control the risks associated with work on fuel train/gas train (fuel supply lines and regulators).
Ensure that procedures are in place to control risks associated with work on electrical boost equipment.
Ensure that procedures are in place for activities that involve maintenance and change of refractory parts (i.e. Orifice Bowl).
Entry procedures and permits are in place for access and egress from the furnace melting chamber or regenerator that is above ambient air temperature.
Required safety equipment identified in relevant procedures are in place and in use.
The machine is equipped with Blank Side Barriers or Anti-deflection bracket covers.
All forming machines should be fitted with sprinkler systems consistent with Space Property Protection Manual â€“ Forming Machine Fire Protection.
A formal machine cleaning program is in place.
During maintenance activity, Lock Out/Tag Out procedures are implemented for all areas of the machine.
Sectional work takes place using procedures including isolation of adjacent sections as appropriate
Ensure that procedures are in place so that the machine can be stopped in the event of an emergency.
Job change safety procedures must be in place and specify safety requirements.
Procedures must be in place for safe clearing of machine jam-ups
Suitable lifting equipment must be in place around the machine to reduce manual handling risks.
Suitable PPE must be worn in the Hot End according to local risk assessments and procedures.
A heat stress management processes should be in place for all workers in the Hot End.
